text:
Razumihin spoke of Raskolnikov’s last year. 

“They want to know everything,” he thought. 

Pulcheria Alexandrovna leaned in. 

“Tell me, Dmitri Prokofitch. How does he look at things now?” 

Dounia sighed, “Mother, how can he answer all that at once?” 

Razumihin shrugged. “I have known Rodion for a year and a half. He’s morose, gloomy, proud.” 

Pulcheria frowned. “I didn’t expect him to be like this.” 

“Three years apart changes people,” Razumihin replied. 

They listened, eager for more.

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Razumihin describes Raskolnikov's character as morose, gloomy, proud, and haughty, while Pulcheria Alexandrovna expresses her eagerness to understand her son's current state.
